intro: Hilliardiella sutherlandii, commonly known as the Sutherland's hilliardiella, is a rare and striking plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It is a succulent shrub characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves and clusters of bright yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to arid and rocky environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It blooms during the cooler months, typically between late winter and early spring.
